citations.title: Improving refugee integration through data-driven algorithmic assignment
citations.claim_in_paper: Refugee resettlement programs have produced migration processes shaped by federal decisions and local placement capacity.
citations.notes: Verified via Scite Assistant. Supports the interaction of federal/local capacity logic.

citations.title: The Renewal of Population Loss in the Nonmetropolitan Great Plains
citations.claim_in_paper: Nonmetropolitan Great Plains population loss is renewed in the late 20th century (context for rural Great Plains decline).
citations.notes: Re-verified via Scite Assistant. Use as support for renewed nonmetropolitan Great Plains population loss; avoid over-claiming specific mechanisms unless directly quoted from the paper.

citations.title: Geography of Population Change and Redistribution within the Post-Frontier Great Plains
citations.claim_in_paper: The Great Plains 'ongoing population decline' narrative is only partly accurate; population growth concentrated in metropolitan counties along the periphery while many interior nonmetropolitan counties decline.
citations.notes: Verified directly from the open-access PDF on DigitalCommons@UNL. Abstract states the 'only partly appropriate' qualifier and the core-periphery divide; paper reports Great Plains population increasing from 9.92M (1930) to 19.80M (2000) and metro share rising (Table 1).

citations.title: Annual Estimates of the Resident Population and Components of Change for the United States, Regions, States, and Puerto Rico: April 1, 2020 to July 1, 2024 (NST-EST2024-ALLDATA)
citations.claim_in_paper: North Dakota accounts for about 0.17% of U.S. net international migration on average over 2010-2024, below its 0.23% share of the U.S. population
citations.notes: Computed directly from local PEP vintages in `data/raw/immigration/census_population_estimates/` (preferring newer revisions for overlapping years).

citations.title: Rural North Dakota's Oil Boom and Its Impact on Social Services
citations.claim_in_paper: The Bakken oil boom brought population growth to rural ND communities that had previously experienced decades of depopulation and economic struggle
citations.notes: Verified via the paper abstract (OpenAlex record for DOI 10.1093/sw/swt068). Abstract text includes: 'This has brought economic expansion and population growth to rural communities that had previously experienced decades of depopulation and economic struggle.' Full-text PDF appears paywalled (OUP 403).

citations.title: Diasporas
citations.claim_in_paper: Concentrations create diaspora networks that are predictive of subsequent migration streams

citations.title: Theories of International Migration
citations.claim_in_paper: Dominant paradigm focuses on national-level flows using gravity models

citations.title: International migration: a panel data analysis
citations.claim_in_paper: Migration forecasting focuses on national-level flows using gravity models calibrated to large-sample settings

citations.title: Immigrant America: A Portrait
citations.claim_in_paper: Subnational analysis focuses on major receiving states (gateway states)

citations.title: Machine Learning vs Statistical Methods for Time Series Forecasting
citations.claim_in_paper: Unit root tests lose power and model selection becomes unreliable in small samples

citations.title: Forecasting: Principles and Practice
citations.claim_in_paper: Long-horizon forecasts carry prediction intervals so wide as to approach uninformativeness
